byline.original: By JOHN HARWOOD, JIM RUTENBERG and JEFF ZELENY
byline.contributor: John Harwood reported from Simpsonville, S.C., Jim Rutenberg from New York, and Jeff Zeleny from Washington. Michael D. Shear contributed reporting from Washington, and Richard A. Oppel Jr. from Charlotte, N.C.

abstract: Texas Gov Rick Perry is taking significant steps to redefine his candidacy as his battle for the Republican presidential nomination intensifies, including unveiling a tax overhaul plan that would give people the option of paying a 20 percent flat tax on income.
snippet: Gov. Rick Perry of Texas is expanding beyond his tight circle of advisers by adding veterans of past Republican campaigns who will help direct his spending, polling and policy development.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Rick Perry of Texas is expanding beyond his tight circle of advisers by adding veterans of past Republican campaigns who will help direct his spending, polling and policy development.
